content.html:
Thanks for stopping by my digital swamp.

Participants welcome 24/7

Guestbook

Contact

Here you can write a few words of feedback or anything else you like. Drop the message here for others to see.

Sign the guestbook[1] to let me know you were here, any additional thoughts, and optionally, where you came from as well as a song recommendation. I love listening to new sounds.

➕ Submit Form powered by web3forms meta : what is a guestbook?

~hedy

Guestbooks are logs of visitors like you, leaving a mark on someone else’s public space. It’s an idea from the older days of the internet borrowing from a decades-old practice that is still alive today in museums, and similar public facilities... It’s fun, and it adds a personal flair to today’s internet run by tech giants and ad-ridden web spaces.

Entries

Messages do not appear automatically. I read and respond to each comment at my own pace.

3 webmentions + 7 messages

Declan Chidlow | 2025-07-15

Stumbled in here from the path. I stubbed my toe on one of the rocks, and a fallen branch snagged my jacket, ripping a hole.

This swamp was at very least better than the Bog of Eternal Stench.

I must be off now, because the ground around my feet is beginning to slurry.

Listen to An Insatiable High by Masayoshi Takanaka Sophia | 2025-07-15

Your garden is delightful. I really enjoy your palette, icons, visualizations, and linkages. What a fun garden to explore - thank you for sharing. I love playing with data as well and am inspired by your flow here.

Listen to "Canción de la Nostalgia" by Jin Yerei Paul G | 2025-07-15

Nice site!

webmention - Christian replied to guestbook | 2025-07-13

Nice to see a guest book which supports webmentions. Have fun! ????

Hedy | 2025-07-12

hello! I love the whole idea behind your site as a "digital garden" and the design of your site, and I'm really glad to know my site has provided you inspiration. looking forward to more recipes and blog posts!

also, thanks for joining the Meta Ring :)

Listen to "Mind Is A Prison" from These Two Windows by Alec Benjamin Max | 2025-07-12

This is awesome, always cool to see what new features you're cooking up.

Listen to "SCATTERBRAIN" from DEADNAMES by PER INK webmention - webmention.rocks | 2025-07-10

Receiver Test #1
This test verifies that you accept a Webmention request that contains a valid source and target URL. To pass this test, your Webmention endpoint must return either HTTP 200, 201 or 202 along with the appropriate headers.

If your endpoint returns HTTP 201, then it MUST also return a Location header. If it returns HTTP 200 or 202, then it MUST NOT include a Location header.

webmention - (me) replied to guestbook | 2025-07-09

This test post links to my guestbook, which should create a webmention when I submit it through the form.

I'll need to remember to use the exact url: https://paologabriel.com/guestbook/

Mert Kaya | 2025-06-24

I came across your page while exploring the Now page movement, and I really enjoyed reading about your journey.

...

Wishing you continued success with your work!

(me) | 2025-06-19

Time to be the first to sign my own guestbook!

Listen to "Hajanga" from In My Room by Jacob Collier

Webmentions

Have you written a response to something on my site? Send me a webmention by submitting the URL below.

Your post URL: Target URL on my site:

Send Webmention

meta : What's a webmention?

A webmention is a way for websites to notify each other when they link to each other. It's like a "ping" that says "Hey, I wrote about your post!" When you mention my site on your blog or social media, you can send a webmention to let me know.

Learn more about webmentions here

  1. Consider creating your own website and include a guestbook like this one too. ↩︎

content.html:
In reply to: James

Joe posted his webmentions page in the IndieWeb chat and it prompted me to try and finally check the other side of webmentions.

It was not the most simple but with the help of James and Aaron I think I have managed to get some reply-to notes set up.
content.text:
In reply to: James

Joe posted his webmentions page in the IndieWeb chat and it prompted me to try and finally check the other side of webmentions.

It was not the most simple but with the help of James and Aaron I think I have managed to get some reply-to notes set up.
